WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name Mrs. M. H. McHenry
Address Regina, Sask.
Birthplace Durham, Eng.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1947
Where did you set up housekeeping? N. 41, W. 26, R. 26, M. 2
Where had you been living before that? Humboldt, Sask.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4 to 5 at harvest
How far was it to your nearest store? 12 miles to brick
How often could a visit be made to the store? Occasionally
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, sugar, dried fruits (prunes, peaches, apricots), fresh apples, tea, coffee beans

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Quaker's Fine Flour
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lb. sacks
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour?
How much did you use graham flour? Some, by 5 lb. bags
Whole wheat flour? None
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 12
That year? 1925
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use? Oatmeal
Cornmeal? No
Whole wheat? A little
Farina? No
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? Hand mill
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? ........................................... 100 lb.

What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? $1.15 (1916)

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? ........................................... White Bar

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? ........................................... 10 lb.

At what price? ......................................................................................... 1.25 for 10 lb.

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? ........................................... From dairy

Milked cows

Butter? ........................................................................................................... Yes

Eggs? ............................................................................................................. No

What was the price of butter? ........................................................................... 12¢ per lb.

Did you pack eggs for winter? ........................................................................... Yes

Hot? .............................................................................................................. No

Did you make butter? ....................................................................................... Yes

Cheese? ........................................................................................................... Yes

What kind of cheese? ....................................................................................... Cheddar, cheddar

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? ........................................... Beef, Pork, Poultry

How did you get fresh meat? ........................................................................... Butchered on farm

How often did you get fresh meat? ................................................................... Weekly

How did you preserve meat? ........................................................................... Home cured

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? ........................................... No

If so what year was it organized? .................................................................... 1913

Did you use game? ......................................................................................... Yes

What kinds? .................................................................................................... Pheasant, quail, pheasant, partridge

For how long? ................................................................................................... No

What part did fish play in the family diet? .................................................... Fresh lake fish

Farmed fish during winter

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? ............................................................ Fresh, frozen, canned (cured)

Kinds? ........................................................................................................... White fish, brown trout, pickerel
3. SUGAR AND STAPLES

In what quantity did you buy and to whom?
What was the price for a ton of sugar? $1.50
What brand of flour did you buy? White Flour
What size of tin of syrup did you buy? 1 lb.

4. MILK PRODUCTS

How did you get your milk in the early days?
That was the price of butter? $2.00
Did you make butter? Yes
Did you make cheese? Yes

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early days?
How did you get fresh meat?
How often did you get fresh meat?
Was there a "meat shop" in your neighborhood?
If so, what year was it organized?
Did you use names?

For how long?
That part of fish play in the family diet?
Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned?
Kind of fish? White fish, salmon, halibut, etc.

6. VEGETABLES

What was the price of vegetables?
Did you grow vegetables?
What kind of vegetables did you grow?
How did you store vegetables?
Was there a "vegetable market" in your neighborhood?
If so, what year was it organized?
Did you use names?

For how long?
That part of vegetables play in the family diet?
Was the vegetables fresh, canned, or preserved?
Kind of vegetables? Green beans, carrots, tomatoes, etc.
6. BEVERAGES

What kind of tea did you buy? [Blue Ribbon] At what price? [1.00]
What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) [Beans] At what price? [35¢]
What other beverages were used? [Buttermilk]

7. VEGETABLES AND DRIED FRUITS

What was the price of potatoes per bushel when you set up housekeeping? [4.5¢]
Could you get potatoes at the store? [Yes]
If not, where from? [Farmers]

What year did you first grow your own supply for the winter of:
Potatoes [1912], Cabbage [1914], Carrots [1912], Onions [1917],
Turnips [1917], Beets [1917]

In what quantities did you buy white navy beans? [10 lb]
How did you buy prunes, (in bulk or by the box)? [By box]
What weight? [25 lb] How did the grocer handle prunes (by box)? [Yes]
What was the price of prunes? [1.00]
What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (apples, pears,
apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currents or others)? [figs]

8. PRESERVING

In the early years did you preserve any foods by drying? [Yes]
Peas? [Yes] Corn? [Yes] Beans? [Yes] Saskatoons? [No]
Other foods? [Raspberries]

What year did you first preserve fruit by canning? [1916]
What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? [1918]
What year did you first preserve meat by canning? [1917]
Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? [Canning]
To what extent? [Home supply]
Did you make your own vinegar? [A little]
6. **BUYING**

   What kind of tea did you buy?  
   What kind of coffee did you buy?  
   What other beverages did you buy?

7. **VEGETABLES AND FRUITS**

   What was the price of potatoes per bushel?

   What weight?  
   What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (apples, pears, apricots, peaches, loquats, raisins, currants or others)?

8. **PRESERVING**

   In what quantities did you buy apples new beans?  
   How did you buy prunes? (In bulk or by the box)?  
   What weight?  
   What year did you first preserve fruits by canning?  
   What year did you first preserve fruits by freezing?  
   Do you still preserve foods by canning or freezing?

   Did you make your own vinegar?

### 12. WATER SUPPLY

*Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (Well, river, slough, dugout)*

**Well**

*How far was this water from your home?*

*Drinking water by well*

*How was it brought to the home? (Well, barrel, tank)*

*Drinking water by well*

*Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.*

*Drilled well & windmill 1918*

*New barnyard*
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Yes.

If you made your own, did you use lye? Yes.

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocers handle? Royal Benson, Safeguard, Ivory.

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? Coal.

Where did you get your fuel? From local sources.

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

Have used oil & Boilers (ignite) late years.

Railroad coal.

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) Yes.

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) No.

By whom was your first cook stove made? Mr. Smith.

What year was it purchased? 1920. Price? $12.00.

What types of utensils did you use? (Iron, copper, tin, homemade)

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other)

When did you first see enamel ware? Early (before 1920).

Aluminum? 1910.
16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

Changes from bulk to jelly.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast - porridge, bacon, eggs, coffee

Dinner - potatoes, eggs, bacon, vegetables, fruit or pudding, pie

Supper - potatoes, eggs, bread, cake

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? 1905. Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Chicken
Turkey
Plum pudding
Xmas Cake
Mince tart

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

1903-4

Snow-blocked stores sold out
Lived on supplies
Down to 1/2 pint of milk + 1 loaf of bread
Burned wheat in stove
Homemade candles
17. Give a typical day's meal (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest settlers in America. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. Tell the approximate north, east, or number.

Breakfast: coffee

Dinner: potatoes, vegetables

Supper: fruit pie

18. That 1903-4 you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Tennessee?

Turkey

Pumpkin pie

Chicken

Pecan pie

Xmas cake

Mincemeat tart

19. Have you ever refused to almost starve on local produce? Give details.

1903-4 Snow-blocked. Starved out.

Burned out cabin.

Homemade candles.
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

More variety today.
More prepared foods today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

Last 10 yrs.
Still use home grown whenever possible.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada.
